title: Introducing: Soft As Snow
content:
With two tracks to their name, coming in at a combined total of over twelve minutes, Norwegian born, London based pop duo Soft As Snow are certainly ambitious.

A cross between the nu-gaze revival that reared it’s head a couple of years back, and the (at times) occasionally passive dream-pop that appears to be dominating blogs at the moment, Oda Egjar Starheim and Øystein Monsen manage to keep their tracks exhilarating from start to finish. Of the two songs, Black Birds is the one that excites me most, with it’s shoegaze leanings, whilst Glass Body squeezes more into the aforementioned dream-pop territory.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
